alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, northeastern Bertie, southeastern Hertford, eastern Currituck and Chowan Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Morgans Corner to near Belvidere to near Colerain. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Winfall and Chapanoke around 710 PM EDT. Elizabeth City and Hertford around 715 PM EDT. Camden, Elizabeth City State University and Burgess around 720 PM EDT. Whitehall Shores, Snug Harbor, Nixonton and Indiantown around 725 PM EDT. Weeksville and Shiloh around 730 PM EDT. Old Trap around 735 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Goose Pond, Poplar Branch, Pierceville, Spot, Arrowhead Beach, Saint Johns, Parkville, Mount Gould, Yeopim Station and Jacocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
